channel.title: Blogs on Dogecoin Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Dogecoin Foundation

item.title: Development Blog - April 2025
item.description: Libdogecoin 0.1.4 Released Since the 0.1.3 release in February 2024, we‚Äôve completed substantial work on Libdogecoin, supporting Dogebox, SPV PUP‚Äîa lightweight node service‚Äîand new key management features. The 0.1.4 release consolidates everything that‚Äôs been in progress since then‚Äîincluding Intel and ARM performance enhancements, REST API extensions for the SPV node, expanded secure enclave support, and the introduction of YubiKey hardware key storage. This post provides a high-level summary of these developments and links to documentation for those looking to integrate or build on top of Libdogecoin.

item.title: We Mourn The Passing Of Kabosu, The Beloved Shiba Inu Who Inspired The Doge Meme And Dogecoin Cryptocurrency.
item.description: We Mourn The Passing Of Kabosu, The Beloved Shiba Inu Who Inspired The Doge Meme And Dogecoin Cryptocurrency. Doge„Éü„Éº„É†„Å®DogecoinÊöóÂè∑ÈÄöË≤®„Å´ÂΩ±Èüø„Çí‰∏é„Åà„ÅüÊúÄÊÑõ„ÅÆÊü¥Áä¨„ÄÅ„Åã„Åº„Åô„ÅÆÊ≠ª„ÇíÊÇº„ÅøËøΩÊÇº„ÇíÊçß„Åí„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ London, UK, May 24th, 2024 ‚Äî It is with great sadness that the Dogecoin Foundation received news of the passing of Kabosu, the beloved shiba inu who inspired the Doge meme and our eponymous cryptocurrency Dogecoin. At the age of 18, Kabosu lived a full and storied life, leaving an indelible mark in the world.

item.title: Development Blog - February 2024
item.description: Happy New Year, Shibes! It’s been a while since our last blog post, but we’ve been busy getting libdogecoin ready for release, as well as working on some other exciting projects. Last year was significant, with the release and continuous improvement of our key initiatives: GigaWallet, LibDogecoin, and RadioDoge. This year, we’re enhancing these projects and introducing new ones, which will be announced next week on a freshly updated Trailmap. We’re excited to share what we’ve been up to and what’s coming up in 2024.

item.title: Development Blog 27th September 2023
item.description: Happy September Shibes! We‚Äôve been busy working on a number of things, and we wanted to share some of the progress we‚Äôve made. The last blog contained bullet points of the things we were working on. In this post we‚Äôll go into more detail on some of the items, and we‚Äôll also share some new things that we‚Äôve been working on. libdogecoin 0.1.3 In this blog post, we’ll explore some of the features introduced in libdogecoin 0.

item.title: Development Blog 12th August 2023
item.description: Ahoy Shibes, in recognition of the fact that devs are usually good at coding but frequently bad at talking, we‚Äôre going to have a shot at maintaining a fortnightly dev-blog for the Dogecoin work going on at the foundation. Not entirely sure if the format will remain the same as we go but it‚Äôs a start! Here‚Äôs an overview of the last 2 weeks: Libdogecoin - Low level C library for building Dogecoin systems

item.title: Fantoumi's questions
item.description: 2022 has been a busy time for the Dogecoin Foundation, there have been solid developments and improvements within the Dogecoin Ecosystem, we‚Äôve had a hugely successful Hackathon that‚Äôs seen many new people introduced to Dogecoin development, and we‚Äôve been able to grow our team through the kind generosity of some big Shibes who are aligned with our mission and want to see us succeed. That said there‚Äôs been a growing anxiety in the community around a couple of topics which have been taken far out of proportion by a small number of people who seem intent on dividing the community rather than working toward consensus.

item.title: Oona wants to say a thing
item.description: In the spirit of improving communications and transparency I‚Äôd like to take the opportunity to rip the Band-Aid off and let it be known that I have been a volunteer with the Dogecoin Foundation for the past six months. Some of you may remember that in June around my birthday I was invited by members of the Foundation for dinner in Austin. It was an absolutely amazing evening getting to know these people in person.

item.title: Shibes raise more than 1,000,000 Dogecoin ($100,000) to build a statue of the Doge!
item.description: In celebration of Kabosu the Doge’s 17th birthday, shibes around the world have raised more than 1,000,000 Dogecoin ($100,000) in donations which will be used to create a bronze statue of Kabosu in her home city of Sakura, Japan. Kabosu’s owner, Atsuko Sato was kind enough to reach out to Sakura city council, who support the idea of including the statue in their 2024 project to revitalise Furusato Square. The funds which were raised have been moved into a multisignature wallet and now the work to make the statue of our beloved Doge a reality begins.

item.title: Shanties, RadioDoge & Financial Freedom
item.description: You’ve probably heard the rousing tale of the whalers from Otakou and the Weller Bros trading company that plied its wares amongst them during the 1800s. What you may not know is that the workers in these stories were often enticed with promises of a good wage, only to find themselves intentionally indebted to trading cooperatives who controlled 100% of the housing, equipment, trade and basic necessities in these remote regions.

item.title: Let's talk about Development
item.description: I know that for non-devs (or ‚Äònot-yet-devs’ üòâ), it can sometimes be difficult to make sense of technical talk. I think that a part of my job as an Engineer at the Dogecoin Foundation is to explain technical things in terms non-tech folk can understand. Because of this, I‚Äôd like to ramble a bit about the Trailmap, about the goals we have and the projects that we‚Äôre hoping will fulfil them.
